text:
Oh man, Rosemont has some great casse-croutes. Miteras looks risky cause it's always empty when I walk by, but we finally went in on a hungry New Year's Eve day when everything else was closed, and the phone was just ringing off the hook- aha- that's where all their business is at: delivery!

We had chicken souvlaki pitas which were very mediocre but very satisfying. A poutine, which was the best one -of the pale frozen fries and (possibly?) canned gravy- I have had in a while. Loads of cheese, and huge. A Greek salad- surprisingly delicious vinaigrette and two glasses of cold clear beer. Mm mmm hit the spot. Next time you are craving delivery from one of those québécois-greek-italian-chinese restaurants, give Miteras a call and the super fast, friendly, accurate and large portions will fill your belly with joy!

I'll counter Luc's post and add Italian on the list.

This greek pizzeria is more italian in simplicity and taste of the sauces than most of the italian restaurants on the island. The pasta may not be fresh and homemade, but the sauces and sides make up for anything you may think is lacking. Try the meatballs or grilled italian sausage with a plate of spaghetti, then tell me I'm wrong.

Pizza greek style. Thick. Yummy. Try it with meat sauce. Heaven.

Homemade tzatziki on souvlaki. Need I say more? Make sure you order extra.

Even the poutine gravy is old school, made from the chicken broth they have on hand after boiling birds for club sandwiches (yes, I learned that little trick years ago from Louis in Verdun) and that alone sets this place apart from others for poutine.

When all is said and done, probably the best all-around choice in Rosemont.
Enjoy.
I wish they would not spam the mailboxes of my neighbourhood with their take-out menu flyers. They Don't seem to care that people have "no flyers" stickers.

Je n'ai jamais compris pourquoi cette pizzeria grecque affiche sur son menu la mention suivante : "spécialité, mets italiens". Vous l'aurez compris à son nom, Miteras Pizzeria ne fait pas très italien. L'endroit offre bel et bien quelques mets de la cuisine italienne (tel que les pâtes), mais en général, tout est grec ici. À commencer par les Souvlakis, les Giros, et les sandwichs pita. À son épaisseur, la pizza est elle aussi d'inspiration grecque. L'endroit offre les mets de la cuisine québécoise dont une poutine respectable servie dans un format imposant. Attention, le commandez pas le plus grands format, c'est vraiment trop gros.   

En bref, Miteras est une pizzeria de quartier classique qui mélange un peu de tout à son menu. On ne vient pas ici pour l'ambiance ou le menu exotique. Mais si on vit dans Rosemont, c'est une place correcte pour venir y manger une pizza entre ami dans un petit resto tranquille.
